name: Forgemaster Valdrin Ashmere
category: Brotherhood of the Forge Master Smith
summary: The second-finest smith in the Brotherhood. Has been second-finest for two centuries. Azrael considers this character-building.
content:
> *"Perfection requires an audience who can recognize it. Most people can't. I forge for the ones who can."*

## Appearance

A drow of middle age — roughly 280 — with the precise movements of a craftsman who has spent centuries teaching his hands to be exact. Silver-white hair kept back. Long fingers, no visible scars, which is either remarkable or a statement. Eyes like polished obsidian that evaluate everything in terms of quality.

## Personality

Quiet, precise, and possessed of a judgment so fine it borders on contempt. Not cruel — merely accurate. Will compliment work he considers adequate. Has not considered much work adequate.

## Motivation

Create something that outlasts Karnuk itself. Achieve the technical perfection that Velith "The Needle" holds and Azrael recognizes. Stop being second.

## Background

Joined the Brotherhood at age 80 as a gifted young smith. Has been outpaced by Velith at every technical benchmark for the last century. Has accepted this the way one accepts weather — it exists, it cannot be changed, and one either forges around it or does not forge at all. Currently working on a commission that Azrael has not revealed to Velith.

## Key Connections

- **Azrael, "The Spider"** — patron, judge, the only opinion that matters
- **Velith "The Needle"** — rival, technically superior, mutual professional respect masking years of quiet resentment
- **Steel Syndicate** — recently approached by Kethar's recruiters; has not yet declined

## Plot Hooks

- The party needs a specific item made — something Valdrin can create, but only at a price that involves his rivalry with Velith.
- He approaches the party with information about the Steel Syndicate's recruitment efforts inside the Brotherhood.
- Something he's been commissioned to make has gone missing. He needs it found before Azrael asks about it.
